emotions.name: Joy
emotions.description: A positive high-arousal emotion signaling reward, safety, and social connection. Involves dopamine and endorphin release, activates the ventral striatum and prefrontal cortex, promoting motivation and approach behavior.

emotions.name: Trust
emotions.description: Emotion of psychological safety and attachment. Mediated by oxytocin and serotonin, activates prefrontal and anterior cingulate regions, supports bonding, empathy, and cooperation.

emotions.name: Fear
emotions.description: Triggered by threat or danger. Activates the amygdala, hypothalamus, and sympathetic nervous system, releasing adrenaline and noradrenaline, preparing the body for fight-or-flight response.

emotions.name: Surprise
emotions.description: A brief startle response to unexpected stimuli. Involves the amygdala and parietal cortex, momentarily increases attention and cognitive flexibility for rapid situational reassessment.

emotions.name: Sadness
emotions.description: Response to loss or disappointment. Decreases dopamine and serotonin activity, heightens right prefrontal and amygdala activation, encouraging reflection and social support seeking.

emotions.name: Disgust
emotions.description: Reaction to contamination or moral violation. Activates the insular cortex, reduces parasympathetic tone, elicits withdrawal behavior and avoidance of harmful stimuli.

emotions.name: Anger
emotions.description: Response to perceived injustice or obstacle. Engages amygdala, hypothalamus, and orbitofrontal cortex, increases adrenaline and cortisol, mobilizing energy for confrontation or correction.

emotions.name: Anticipation
emotions.description: Forward-looking emotional state tied to prediction and planning. Involves dopamine circuits of the nucleus accumbens and prefrontal cortex, enhancing motivation and goal-directed behavior.

triggers.name: Life Event
triggers.description: Significant occurrences in daily life, such as births, deaths, or major life changes.

triggers.name: Social Interaction
triggers.description: Encounters with other people including arguments, compliments, or meeting new individuals.

triggers.name: Achievement
triggers.description: Accomplishments or completed goals that can influence mood and behavior.

triggers.name: Setback
triggers.description: Obstacles, failures, or frustrations that may affect actions and thoughts.

triggers.name: Financial Status
triggers.description: Situations related to personal financial state, budgeting, or income levels.

triggers.name: New Experience
triggers.description: Novel events such as meeting someone new, traveling, or trying a new activity.

triggers.name: Rumor / News
triggers.description: Information received from others, gossip, or news that affects thoughts or emotions.

triggers.name: Chance / Coincidence
triggers.description: Unexpected events, serendipity, or random encounters that impact mood or decisions.

triggers.name: Responsibility
triggers.description: Obligations in studies, work, or personal relationships that create pressure or require attention.

triggers.name: Health
triggers.description: Physical or mental health conditions that influence mood, energy, and overall emotional state.

sequences.title: Morning Walk Calmness
sequences.summary: Went for a morning walk and felt peaceful anticipation for the day.

sequences.title: Missed Assignment Deadline
sequences.summary: Missed a project submission and felt a wave of sadness and frustration.

thought.content: I should have managed my time better.

behavior.content: Took a break to reflect before contacting the instructor.

notes.content: Will plan deadlines earlier next time.

sequences.title: Pre-Exam Fear
sequences.summary: Felt fear about the upcoming test despite preparation.

thought.content: What if I fail even after studying?

behavior.content: Practiced breathing exercises to calm nerves.

notes.content: Calmed down after a short break.

sequences.title: Unexpected Call from Friend
sequences.summary: Surprised by a friend’s spontaneous call which lifted mood.

thought.content: Didn’t expect this but it made me happy.

behavior.content: Talked for 15 minutes and felt energized.

notes.content: Should reach out to friends more often.

sequences.title: Teamwork and Cooperation
sequences.summary: Collaborated smoothly with classmates and felt strong trust.

thought.content: Working together feels easier than alone.

notes.content: Plan to keep this group dynamic.

sequences.title: Argument at Home
sequences.summary: Felt anger during a disagreement about chores.

thought.content: I’m tired of always reminding others.

notes.content: Need to express frustration calmly next time.

sequences.title: Cleaning Motivation
sequences.summary: Organized workspace and felt joy afterward.

thought.content: I feel better in a clean environment.

sequences.title: Spoiled Food Reaction
sequences.summary: Ate spoiled food by mistake and felt disgust.

behavior.content: Threw it away immediately and cleaned up.

notes.content: Will check expiration dates more carefully.

sequences.title: Good News from a Friend
sequences.summary: Heard uplifting news about a friend's success and felt joyful surprise.

sequences.title: Planning Next Week
sequences.summary: Planned next week’s tasks and felt anticipation about upcoming opportunities.

behavior.content: Created a detailed schedule for upcoming projects.
JUMPED AND LAUGHED AND EUPHORIA AND NIRVANA

notes.content: ALL IS GOOD LIFE IS GOOD
